byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Caroline Chauvet from Paris.

abstract: People of Central African Republic begin voting in long-delayed presidential and parliamentary elections, best hope for reuniting country in wake of three years of sectarian violence; observers report heavy turnout and peaceful process at polls.
lead_paragraph: Citizens have begun casting ballots in what could represent the best hope of reuniting the country, one of the world’s poorest, after three years of sectarian violence.

headline.main: Central African Republic Elections, Long Delayed, Are Peaceful
headline.print_headline: Elections in Central African Republic, Long Postponed, Are Peaceful

snippet: Citizens have begun casting ballots in what could represent the best hope of reuniting the country, one of the world’s poorest, after three years of sectarian violence.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
